comments.body:
I don't think you can properly get symbol from stacktrace and the logic will always be flaky. Jumping to the line is enough. For example:
```
Exception in thread "main" java.lang.Exception
	at Main$.$anonfun$main$1(Main.scala:13)
	at Main$.$anonfun$main$1$adapted(Main.scala:10)
	at scala.collection.immutable.Range.foreach(Range.scala:190)
	at Main$.main(Main.scala:10)
	at Main.main(Main.scala)
```

It's not possible to map the full symbol `Main$.$anonfun$main$1` to anything similar in sematicDB. We can only map a part of it, which will make the logic flaky. I would drop going to definition.

Although we could do `toplevelFromLine` and just get the toplevel via:
```scala
private def getSymbolFromLine(line: String): String = {
  val toplevel = line.substring(line.indexOf("at ") + 3, line.indexOf("."))
  val descriptor = if(toplevel.endsWith("$")) List(Descriptor.Term) else List(Descriptor.Type)
  BuildTargetClasses.symbolFromClassName(toplevel.stripSuffix("$"), descriptor)
}
```

We might need to move the method from BuildTargetClasses if it makes sense. It's in the class, so some modification will be needed.
